trial_identification.studytitle: Probiotic Intervention to reduce streptococcal disease burden in New Zealand Children
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Placebo controlled trial of the effect of BLIS probiotic, S salivarius (K12) on culture positive S pyogenes pharyngitis amongst 5-14 year old children

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Studies of infection and infectious agents

interventions.interventions: Daily S. salivarius probiotic 10^8 cfu's per lozenge. One lozenge daily for 3 school terms during term time. Approx 145 school days. It is not possible to be precise because schools have flexibility over term length and there are 11 schools involved. Lozenges will be administered each day by a school staff member and a record of administration will be kept

primaryOutcome.outcome: proportion of children with S pyogenes positive sore throat during treatment period. Measured by standard micro throat swab for GAS
primaryOutcome.timepoint: proportion during treatment period ie approx 145 days of three school terms

secondaryOutcome.outcome: proportion of children with S. pyogenes carriage at end of trial in treatment versus placebo group. Measured by standard culture of a throat swab for GAS
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: end of treatment period. ie approx 145 days of treatment

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: All children currently enrolled in Ministry of Health throat swabbing and treatment programme in East Porirua
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: 1) Children with major heart disease as determined by study investigators. 2) Children with severe immune function impairment as determined by study investigators

trial_design.concealment: This is a community trial in primary and intermediate schools amongst children who are already enrolled in Ministry of Health programme and who's parents consent to their participation in this trial.
trial_design.sequence: The only practical method of allocation is to use children's birthday. That is children born on 'even numbered days will receive one treatment. Children born on odd numbered days will receive the alternate treatment
trial_design.statisticalmethods: Assuming rate of GAS pharyngitis is 10% during study period With 800 subjects in treatment and placebo arms we will be able to detect a 50% reduction with power 0.97. For 500 subjects per group power 0.82. (alpha 0.05)

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Level 3 - ProCARE Building, Grafton Mews, at 110 Stanley Street, Auckland 1010

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The study is designed to measure the efficacy of the S. salivarius probiotic to reduce (Group A beta haemolytic strepotoccus) GAS sore throats in high risk children

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Central Health and Disability Ethics Committee
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: 1 The Terrace C/- MEDSAFE, Level 6, Deloitte House 10 Brandon Street PO Box 5013 Wellington 6011
